intro: Elsholtzia communis var. longipilosa, commonly known as the long-haired elsholtzia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of China. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered with fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and densely covered with silky white pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is well adapted to dry conditions, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
